alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:54PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Baker and north central Malheur Counties through 730 PM PDT... At 654 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brogan Hill Summit, or 30 miles west of Weiser, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brogan and Jamieson around 810 PM MDT. Brosman Mountain and California Mountain around 830 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. When safe to do so, please relay storm reports to the National Weather Service in Boise via local law enforcement, or National Weather Service Boise Facebook and Twitter accounts. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM PDT for southeastern and northeastern Oregon.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
